results.title: World of pets : Fish
results.creator_credit: Dennis B. Kane and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World of pets”.
This film explores the world of fish by demonstrating to students how to set up an aquarium and how to care for goldfish, as well as a practical discussion of the anatomy, perception and breeding behaviour of fish. Students will discover that fish not only make colourful pets but that they also can be used to explore animal behaviour and to teach responsibility. Suitable for Middle-Upper Primary level students. Teacher’s guide included.

results.title: World of pets : dogs
results.creator_credit: Chris Brown and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World of pets”.
This film explores the world of the dog as a companion to humans. By focussing on a golden retriever and her puppies, from birth to maturity, we observe the dog’s behaviour as it interacts with other dogs and the human family which adopts it. Suitable for Middle-Upper Primary level students. Teacher’s guide included.

results.title: Casey
results.creator_credit: Neil Munro, Tom Haydon and ABC
results.brief_description: This film is a view of the life and career of the former Governor-General of Australia, Lord Casey. It is the first film about Lord Casey and covers the span of years from his birth in Brisbane in 1890 to his installation as a Knight of Garter at Windsor Castle nearly eighty years later. Following on from his political career which included such appointments as Treasurer in the Lyons government, Minister of Supply and Development in the first Menzies government, six years of World War II as the first Australian Minister to the United States and eventually Minister for External Affairs, Lord Casey finally became Governor-General of Australia in 1966. Photographers: Les Wesley, John Atkinson, Ron Bollman, David Brill.

results.title: Cats & dogs = Cats and dogs [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Guterman, Craig Perry, Warren Zide, Chris DeFaria, Andrew Lazar and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: A young beagle finds himself a player in a canines versus felines war when he is introduced to the Brody family. Now named Lou, he is quickly acquainted with Butch, Chief Agency Dog, who introduces him to fellow agents Peek and Sam, as well as tracing the origins of mission he is now an integral part of - Action Plan Delta. Action Plan Delta comprises of replacing the previous catnapped pet, Buddy, and guarding the Brody home from cat invasion. The cats are intent on entering the household to gain access to a serum Mr Brody has been perfecting - a serum which prevents dog allergies. In the wrong hands (paws), the serum could be reversed and create widespread dog allergies, thus allowing cats to become man’s best friend. Leader of the cat movement is a white feline with the undignified name of Mr Tinkles. When the cats infiltrate the Brody home the dogs cast a vote as to whether they should save family or formula. Featuring impressive special effects, “Cats & dogs” presents an interesting take on the spy/action genre (Mission Impossible in particular), with all that you’d expect to see in such a film: secret agents, Russian spies, inventive weapons and perverse interrogation techniques. It’s also concerned about the love between man and pet - with dogs in particular. Voices provided by Tobey Maguire (Lou), Alec Baldwin (Butch), Sean Hayes (Mr Tinkle), Susan Sarandon (Ivy), Michael Clarke Duncan (Sam) Joe Pantoliano (Peek) and Charlton Heston (the Mastiff). Cast also includes Elizabeth Perkins and Miriam Margolyes. Creature effects by Jim Henson’s Creature Shop.

results.title: Cats
results.creator_credit: David Mallet, Andrew Lloyd Webber and Really Useful Films
results.brief_description: ‘Cats’ is the longest-running musical in the history of the London West End and Broadway Theatre. The musical exploded onto the West End in 1981 and became an instant hit world wide, with “Memory” one of it’s classic and recognisable songs. Based on “Old Possum’s book of practical cats” by T.S. Eliot - CATS is a stunning production with a star studded cast including Elaine Paige and Sir John Mills. The costumes and choreography are superb, effectively transforming humans into felines. Using the latest technology, all the excitement, thrill, romance and intimacy of this theatrical legend is captured on screen. With breathtaking visuals and full digital sound from a 70 piece orchestra, one is lead into the mysterious world of cats.
